channel.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
channel.description:
What was the first ever game your purchased for Steam and when? Also if you want to you can include how you got it. :stuck_out_tongue:
Game(s) - The Orange Box When - July 2009 How - Retail £14.99
Thought I'd get to know some people a little better. :smiley:

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)

item.description:
The Orange Box.

Read full topic

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Half-Life, early October 2007. Already played it on PS2 at my friend’s house and had the xbox version of HL2.

I dodged the whole “I just got orange box and what is this” bullet by a few months.

saivert:

what is the value in knowing what was the first steam game someone else played?

shorter: what is the point of this thread exactly?

I’ll soon make a thread “what is your favorite color?”

Pfft. Buzzkiller.

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: henry132
item.description:
My first Steam game (pack) would be the Half-Life 2 Holiday 2006 pack. Before that I used my uncle’s son’s Steam account
I had Half-Life retail, but I lost the damn box so I couldn’t activate it in Steam. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: Narfin
item.description:
Mith:

Half-Life 1. Had it from retail before Steam launch, then got it registered into Steam when the whole launching with CS 1.6 and all that happened.

Steam used to suck major balls back then hahah. I remember all the rage because WON was getting shut down and everyone had to play on Steam now… shit kept crashing every 2 hours

Forgot to mention… first Steam-bought game was Half-Life 2 a few months (six or so) after release date.

This is exactly how I got Steam, except even after Steam came out I still bought everything retail. My first Steam purchase was Audiosurf in 2008.

Read full topic

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I was under the impression that no one played this game.

And you’d be right. Haven’t touched it in years, and only played it for about a month.

It’s an interesting concept, but the game doesn’t keep attention very long and still feels very bland and empty after very few games.

Read full topic

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
chickennoodle:

first game i ever registered was regular CS when steam first came out, but after i registered it my computer was unable to handle steam and cs open at the same time so needless to say my first steam impression was pretty annoying. first game i paid for on it was HL2

ronaldtaylor:

The first game I ever recorded was when regular steam CS first came out, but after I registered my computer was not able to process steam and cs open at the same time, so of course, my first impression was of steam pretty boring. The first game I paid it was HL2

Those entries are weirdly similar.

Read full topic

item.title: Your First Steam Game(s)
item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
The Valve Premier Pack, for free. it was with an ATI card someone bought and he only wanted the card, so he gave me the voucher.

After that, the first thing I actually paid for was SiN Episodes: Emergence, which I bought retail for $20. My first actual Steam purchase was the ID Super Pack for $63.

Read full topic
